PermissibleValues.value: Concurrent and Adjuvant to Radiation therapy
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Concurrent And Adjuvant To Radiation Therapy

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Concurrent And Adjuvant To Radiation Therapy
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Occurring or operating at the same time.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: An agent that enhances the activity or therapeutic effect of another pharmacologic substance without having much, if any, therapeutic impact by itself.: Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
